metadata.title: CVE-2020-10703 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
A NULL pointer dereference was found in the libvirt API responsibleintroduced in upstream version 3.10.0, and fixed in libvirt 6.0.0, forfetching a storage pool based on its target path. In more detail, this flawaffects storage pools created without a target path such as network-basedpools like gluster and RBD. Unprivileged users with a read-only connectioncould abuse this flaw to crash the libvirt daemon, resulting in a potentialdenial of service.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-10703` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss-libvirt - 4.0.0-1ubuntu8.17
libvirt-bin - 4.0.0-1ubuntu8.17
libvirt-clients - 4.0.0-1ubuntu8.17
libvirt-daemon - 4.0.0-1ubuntu8.17
libvirt-daemon-driver-storage-gluster - 4.0.0-1ubuntu8.17
libvirt-daemon-driver-storage-rbd - 4.0.0-1ubuntu8.17
libvirt-daemon-driver-storage-sheepdog - 4.0.0-1ubuntu8.17
libvirt-daemon-driver-storage-zfs - 4.0.0-1ubuntu8.17
libvirt-daemon-system - 4.0.0-1ubuntu8.17
libvirt-sanlock - 4.0.0-1ubuntu8.17
libvirt-wireshark - 4.0.0-1ubuntu8.17
libvirt0 - 4.0.0-1ubuntu8.17
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libvirt package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.0.0-1ubuntu8.17').
